info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 15 at 5:37PM MDT until March 16 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: .Moderate to heavy rain will fall on a deep, primed snowpack in the headwaters of the Virgin River, Paria, Kanab Creek, and Buckskin, leading to increased snow melt and runoff. Flows on all area streams, rivers and slot canyons will be high and will continue to produce areas of flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...High flows on all area streams, rivers, and slot canyons across southwest Utah caused by rain and snowmelt will continue. * WHERE...A portion of Utah, including the following areas, South Central Utah, Lower Washington County and Zion National Park. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff is resulting in some flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations and additional flooding remains possible. Additional creeks and streams may rise out of their banks and additional flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain combined with snowmelt. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible additional Flood Warnings. Those with outdoor recreation plans across southern Utah that include slot canyons or travel in or near normally dry washes, streams, and rivers should consider postponing until runoff recedes.
